data.title: Z Databases
data.text:
The following databases are newly acquired or being evaluated for a future subscription.

CINAHL Ultimate This link opens in a new window

Trial

CINAHL Ultimate provides 1,815 active full-text journals and covers over 50 nursing specialties. Additionally, it features full-text quick lessons, evidence-based care sheets, continuing education modules, nursing instructional videos, and more.

LabArchives This link opens in a new window

New

UNDER the "Select Institution" drop-down menu, choose "University of Florida." Next, PRESS the "Go to Institution's Login" button. LabArchives is a suite of applications that help you manage and document research data, collaborate, and manage inventory, samples, and lab resources.

Musical Theater Songs This link opens in a new window

New

Draws from 150 years of musical theater repertoire to help find songs. Links to various sites for locating sheet music and recordings.

National Theatre Collection This link opens in a new window

New

Access to high-definition streaming video of productions and archival material offering insight into theatre and performance studies.

(Collaboration with the U.K.â€™s National Theatre)

SAGE - Democracy and Elections 2024 This link opens in a new window

New

SAGE: This collection of freely accessible social and behavioral science-based resources will support both classroom-based and scholarly discussions surrounding the upcoming elections. As we approach a pivotal moment in history, with over 60 national elections set to take place in 2024, this unprecedented wave of democratic engagement underscores the importance of informed discourse.

Twentieth Century Religious Thought: Vol. I, Christianity This link opens in a new window

Trial

Includes the complete 17-volume German edition of Dietrich Bonhoeffer Werke (DBW) and English edition of the Dietrich Bonhoeffer Works Series (DBWE) as well as an international selection of English-language editions of key authors such as Pope Benedict XVI, Hans Urs von Baltasar, Leonardo Boff, and more.
